question_text: A 31-year-old man is evaluated for the acute onset of skin lesions on his inner thighs, as shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: Pink papules and pustules centered on hair follicles are characteristic of folliculitis (Option B). The beard, pubic areas, axillae, and thighs are often affected; however, it can appear on any hair-bearing area of skin. Folliculitis can be noninfectious (HIV-associated eosinophilic folliculitis) or infectious. The most frequent cause of infectious folliculitis is Staphylococcus aureus.
